articles.headline: Biden Scrambles to Contain Economic and Political Fallout of Port Strike
articles.snippet: The labor dispute has forced President Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris into a complicated position just weeks before the election.
articles.abstract: The labor dispute has forced President Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris into a complicated position just weeks before the election.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden urged the alliance representing port employers to present a fair offer to striking longshoremen on Tuesday as the White House scrambled to contain the economic and political fallout of the work stoppage at U.S. ports.

articles.headline: Truckers See Ports Turn Into Ghost Towns, and Worry About Their Future
articles.snippet: The strike by longshoremen has halted commerce at Newark and other ports on the East and Gulf Coasts, affecting an ecosystem of supply-chain workers.
articles.abstract: The strike by longshoremen has halted commerce at Newark and other ports on the East and Gulf Coasts, affecting an ecosystem of supply-chain workers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Every workday, on his early-morning drive to his job overseeing a warehouse in northern New Jersey, Sean Murphy takes in the frenetic scene of the busiest port on the East Coast.

articles.headline: Iran Launches Barrage of Ballistic Missiles at Israel in Retaliation for Assassinations
articles.snippet: The 180 missiles fired at Israel on Tuesday evening sharply escalated the conflict between the two countries and threatened to engulf the Middle East in all-out war.
articles.abstract: The 180 missiles fired at Israel on Tuesday evening sharply escalated the conflict between the two countries and threatened to engulf the Middle East in all-out war.
articles.lead_paragraph: Iran fired waves of ballistic missiles at Israel on Tuesday evening, the Israeli military said, an attack that sharply escalated the conflict between Israel and Iran and threatened to engulf the Middle East in all-out war.
articles.byline: By Patrick Kingsley, Aaron Boxerman, Ronen Bergman, Eric Schmitt and Farnaz Fassihi

articles.headline: A Wider War in the Middle East, From Hamas to Hezbollah and Now Iran
articles.snippet: The main questions now are how much the conflict will escalate and whether the United States will get more directly involved in the defense of Israel.
articles.abstract: The main questions now are how much the conflict will escalate and whether the United States will get more directly involved in the defense of Israel.
articles.lead_paragraph: The long-feared “wider war” in the Middle East is here.

articles.headline: The Moment When Vance Dodged a Jan. 6 Question but Said Plenty
articles.snippet: JD Vance sailed fairly smoothly through some 90 minutes of Tuesday’s debate with Tim Walz. Then the subject turned to the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol.
articles.abstract: JD Vance sailed fairly smoothly through some 90 minutes of Tuesday’s debate with Tim Walz. Then the subject turned to the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol.
articles.lead_paragraph: JD Vance wanted to focus on the future, he said. His past, and his party’s, intervened.

articles.headline: A Venture Capital Firm Does Something Rare: Give Money Back
articles.snippet: CRV, based in Silicon Valley, plans to return to investors $275 million because the market for mature start-ups has soured.
articles.abstract: CRV, based in Silicon Valley, plans to return to investors $275 million because the market for mature start-ups has soured.
articles.lead_paragraph: Venture capital firms raise money — lots of it — and invest it in start-ups in hopes of generating big returns. One thing they rarely do is give the money back.

articles.headline: Apple’s A.I. Is Landing Soon on iPhones. Here’s What It’s Like.
articles.snippet: The initial version of Apple Intelligence focuses on helping you with words and photos. Prepare to be impressed and unnerved.
articles.abstract: The initial version of Apple Intelligence focuses on helping you with words and photos. Prepare to be impressed and unnerved.
articles.lead_paragraph: Apple’s most important new product of the year (sorry, it’s not a $3,500 headset) will arrive this month. Apple Intelligence, a suite of software tools bringing what Apple describes as artificial intelligence to its devices, will be released through free software updates for owners of some iPhones, Macs and iPads.

articles.headline: Did Apple Just Kill Social Apps?
articles.snippet: Some app makers worry that a subtle change to the iPhone’s contact-sharing permissions could make it hard for them to get the fast growth they need to compete.
articles.abstract: Some app makers worry that a subtle change to the iPhone’s contact-sharing permissions could make it hard for them to get the fast growth they need to compete.
articles.lead_paragraph: This year, when Apple announced iOS 18, the latest version of its mobile operating system, most of the attention went to its slate of new artificial intelligence features.

articles.headline: Hurricane Helene Deaths Will Continue for Years, Study Suggests
articles.snippet: Research on hundreds of tropical storms finds that mortality keeps rising for more than a decade afterward, for reasons you might not expect.
articles.abstract: Research on hundreds of tropical storms finds that mortality keeps rising for more than a decade afterward, for reasons you might not expect.
articles.lead_paragraph: Over the past week, the official death toll from Hurricane Helene has surpassed 100 as the vortex creeping inland from Florida submerged homes and swept away cars. But the full weight of lost lives will be realized only years from now — and it could number in the thousands.
